properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: ALL APARTMENT INDIVIDUAL GAS FURNACE HOT WATER TANK NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: APARTMENT 3540 1-W; 3542-B - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS ARE MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3544 W/BASEMENT NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO SMOKE DETECTOR 1ST FLOOR UNIT
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO CO DETECTOR 1ST FLOOR UNIT
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: LAUNDRY ROOM MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: FRONT STAIRS AND 1ST NORTH MISSING DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: APARTMENT 2N, MISSING DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: MISSING DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1R NO SMOKE DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1R NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: APT. 2 - MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR NEAR SLEEPING ROOMS MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR NEAR SLEEPING ROOMS SMOKE DETECTORS MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 14 S. / APT. B, 16 S. / APTS. 1 & 2 - MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: FIRST FLOOR APT. MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR. FRONT AND REAR ENCLOSED STAIRWAYS, MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: FIRST FLOOR APT.MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 18 S HOMAN 2ND FLOOR CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR OUT OF SERVICE.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 18 S HOMAN 2ND FLOOR APT USING STOVE FOR HEAT AT TIME OF INSPECTION.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: FRONT PORCH (GRADE TO 2CD). THIS IS A 2 LEVEL STEEL AND WOOD PORCH. ALL OF THE METAL COMPONENTS ARE SEVERELY RUSTED AND PITTED AT BOTH THE TOP AND UNDERSIDE. THIS CONDITION IS ONGOING AND WILL CONTINUE TO DEGRADE THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY / SAFETY OF THIS PORCH. THE 2CD LEVEL DECK IS COMPOSED OF WOOD BOARDS SUPPORTED BY WATER SATURATED FLOOR JOISTS. THESE FLOOR JOISTS ARE FASTENED TO THE PORCH STRUCTURE WITH METAL JOIST HANGERS THAT ARE SEVERELY RUSTED (BOTH THE JOIST HANGERS AND NAILS ARE RUSTED). THE OVERALL CONDITION OF THIS FRONT PORCH IS DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS. REAR PORCH PORCH (GRADE TO 2CD). THIS IS AN ALL WOOD PORCH. THERE ARE 3 STAIR STRINGERS SUPPORTING THE STAIR FLIGHT AND TREADS. THESE STAIR STRINGERS ARE SEVERELY OVER CUT AND HAVE BECOME WEAKENED STRUCTURALLY DUE TO MULTIPLE WOOD FRACTURES AND SECTIONS OF STAIR STRINGER FALLING OFF. THIS STAIR SYSTEM OF THIS PORCH IS DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS. PERMIT REQUIRED FOR FRONT / REAR PORCH REPAIR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Failed to repair or replace defective or missing members of porch system.  (13-196-570, 13-196-641)

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NOTE; THERE ARE 9 FRONT AND 9 REAR PORCHES AT THIS TOWNHOUSE COMPLEX. THE DEFICIENCIES OF THESE PORCHES ARE IDENTICAL. THIS PORTION OF MY REPORT REGARDING PORCH DEFECTS IS TO BE ASSIGNED TO EACH AND EVREY ONE OF THESE 9 FRONT AND 9 REAR PORCHES. FRONT PORCHES (GRADE TO 2CD LEVEL). THESE 9 PORCHES ARE 2 LEVEL STEEL AND WOOD PORCHES. ALL OF THE METAL COMPONENTS ARE SEVERELY RUSTED AND PITTED AT BOTH TOP AND UNDERSIDE. THIS CONDITION IS ONGOING AND WILL CONTINUE TO DEGRADE THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY / SAFETY OF THESE PORCHES. THE 2CD LEVEL DECK IS COMPOSED OF WOOD BOARDS SUPPORTED BY WATER SATURATED FLOOR JOISTS. THESE FLOOR JOISTS ARE FASTENED TO THE PORCH STRUCTURE WITH METAL JOIST HANGERS THAT ARE SEVERELY RUSTED (BOTH THE METAL JOIST HANGERS AND THE NAILS USED AS FASTENERS ARE RUSTED). THE LEDGER BEAMS AT THE 2CD LEVEL DECKS ARE NAIL FASTENED TO THE BUILDING STRUCTURE ... NO SHEAR RESISTANT / RUST RESISTENT FASTENERS WERE USED TO SECURE THE DECKS TO THE BUILDING STRUCTURE AT THESE CRITICAL CONNECTIONS. THE OVERALL CONDITIONS AT THESE FRONT PORCHES ARE TO BE CONSIDERED DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS. REAR PORCHES (GRADE TO 2CD LEVEL) ... THESE 9 PORCHES ARE COMPOSED OF WOOD. THERE ARE 3 STAIR STRINGERS SUPOPORTING THE STAIR FLIGHTS AND STAIR TREDS. THESE STRINGERS ARE SEVERELY OVERCUT AND HAVE BECOME WEAKENED STRUCTURALLY DUE TO MULTIPLE WOOD FRACTURES AND SECTIONS OF STAIR STRINGERS FALLING OFF. THESE STAIR SYSTEMS OF THESE PORCHES ARE DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS. PERMIT REQUIRED FOR ALL PORCH REPAIRS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Failed to repair or replace defective or missing members of porch system.  (13-196-570, 13-196-641)

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: REAR ... IN LIEU OF A STAIR SYSTEM WITH 36" WIDE, SOLID STAIR TREADS, 42" BANISTERS WITH PICKETS SPACED 4" AND  INTERMITTANT LANDINGS ... THERE EXISTS A METAL FIRE ESCAPE FROM THE 3RD LEVEL ATTIC DWELLING UNIT TO GRADE THAT DOES NOT HAVE ANY OF THE MININUM REQUIREMENTS OF A "STANDARD" EXTERIOR STAIR SYSTEM. THE PROVISIONS FOR ALLOWING A FIRE ESCAPE ARE MENTIONED IN SECTION 34(13-200-330). THIS SECTION CODE STATES THAT A FIRE ESCAPE WILL BE ALLOWED IF A MORE CONVENTIONAL MEANS OF EGRESS CANNOT BE CONSTRUCTED. AT THIS PROPERTY, THERE IS ROOM TO INSTALL A CONVENTIONAL STAIR SYSTEM THAT MEETS THE MINIMUM BUILDING CODE REQUIREMENTS. PLANS AND A PERMIT ARE REQUIRED TO CONSTRUCT A NEW STAIR SYSTEM AFTER REMOVING THE EXISTING FIRE ESCAPE.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: CN070024 ? FRONT PORCH  (2 LEVELS). THIS IS A METAL AND WOOD PORCH SYSTEM. ALL OF THE METAL COMPONENTS ARE SEVERELY RUSTED AND PITTED AT BOTH THE TOP AND UNDERSIDE. THIS CONDITION IS ONGOING  AND WILL CONTINUE TO DEGRADE THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY / SAFETY OF THIS PORCH. THE 2CD LEVEL DECK IS COMPOSED OF WOOD BOARDS SUPPORTED BY WATER SATURATED FLOOR JOISTS. THESE FLOOR JOISTS ARE FASTENED TO THE PORCH STRUCTURE WITH METAL JOIST HANGERS THAT ARE SEVERELY RUSTED (BOTH THE JOIST HANGER AND NAILS ARE RUSTED). THE OVERALL CONDITION OF THIS FRONT PORCH IS DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS.REAR PORCH (GRADE TO 2CD). THIS IS AN ALL WOOD PORCH. THERE ARE 3 STAIR STRINGERS SUPPORTING THE STAIR FLIGHT AND TREADS. THESE STRINGERS ARE SEVERELY OVERCUT AND HAVE BECOME WEAKENED STRUCTURALLY DUE TO MULTIPLE WOOD FRACTURES AND SECTIONS OF STAIR STRINGER FALLING OFF. THIS STAIR SYSTEM OF THIS PORCH IS DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS. PERMIT REQUIRED FOR REPAIRS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Failed to repair or replace defective or missing members of porch system.  (13-196-570, 13-196-641)
